Summary My career has been split between wealth management and estate planning, and IT. 
 
For the first 15 years, I managed trusts and estates, marketed those services, and was an acknowledged tax specialist in those areas, particularly in retirement planning. I gained extensive public speaking experience before audiences large and small, including corporate boards of directors, and was invited to act as sole financial services speaker for a major US corporation around the country, even after I left the trust and investment business! Wrote financial software, copies of which were sold to 3 major banks. 
 
In late 1990 made the move to IT. That career began on a bank trading floor in Houston, moved to a corporate data center, to a unique company with a major share in its market, and as of mid-2009 to IBM. In the early part of that IT career, I authored shareware packages that became top downloads in the languages sections of some online services. One of those has been mentioned in a book. 
 
For the past 12 years, I have acted as project manager and/or architect of large scale software and technology initiatives. 
 
Specialties: Project management, software design/development, operations, performance testing and optimizations. Summary My career has been split between wealth management and estate planning, and IT.

Experience Advisory IT Architect IBM August 2009  – Present (6 years 1 month) Top level support for several key high transaction systems. Liason between operations/performance team and application development services. Design and execution of performance tests, and optimization of systems. 
 
Participating in the design of custom ECM applications. Senior Software Architect Viewpointe Archive Services, LLC August 2001  –  July 2009  (8 years) Project manager, architect and implementation roles for major check image archive and check image exchange technology initiatives. These have been leadership, hands-on roles involving all aspects of project management, operations and support, architectural design, testing, implementation, requiring extensive co-ordination with customers, third-party software and hardware vendors, and internal resources. VP JPMorgan Chase December 1990  –  August 2001  (10 years 9 months) In late 1990 I changed careers, moving to IT on the bank's trading floor. That role encompassed network management, software development in multiple languages and numerous APIs, installation of trading platforms, risk and security management. During this period I authored a programming API that achieved high ratings and was mentioned in one book. 
 
I managed a systems software group responsible for the first Unix and Oracle databases in the corporate data center, recruited the first DBAs, and co-managed numerous large scale projects. Highlights include a statewide Tivoli implementation, desktop and server OS standards, and software distribution methodology. 
 
The last project was management of implementation, application support and certification of customers for Spectrum EBP, LLC, a consortium for electronic bill payment and presentment formed by three major banks. Summary I’m an IT Architect with 12 years of experience in IT industry. I have worked on system integration and design for major clients in various industries includes Telecom, Banking, Oil & Gas. I have been recognized with several awards during my career. 
 
Until recently, I involved in two banking regional solution project such as regional payment and regional card. In this role I was focused on system integration architecture design, although I have done extensive integration development work in the past. Successes included creating a integration strategy and approach for the regional solution which able to fit into the client existing infrastructure and application ecosystem. 
 
Colleagues know me as an experience IT Architect who can always be trusted to come up with a reliable and sustainable integration solution and architecture. But I know that the right IT infrastructure design make a good foundation for any IT system integration projects. Hence I always spend a lot of time to understand business and applications to derive a right IT infrastructure architecture for both hardware and software. I can (and often do) work well alone, but I’m at my best collaborating with others. 
 
I have a Computer Science Degree from University of Malaya and I'm a TOGAF Certified Architect.
